title: ICE When Swapping Const Generic & Generic In Trait Method Impl

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code This is really as simple as ICEs get. ```Rust // No ICE here. trait CrunchICE { fn crunch(ice: T); } // Cold crunchy ICE here. impl CrunchICE for () { // Note that the const generic and generic have swapped places here. fn crunch(ice: T) {} } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.62.0-nightly (69a5d2481 2022-04-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 69a5d2481e856a5a18885390b8cf6950b9ff8dd3 commit-date: 2022-04-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.62.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.1 ``` This *also* appears to work on stable from play.rust-lang.org. ``` note: rustc 1.61.0 (fe5b13d68 2022-05-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ``` ### Error output
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/subst.rs:621:17: expected type for `W/#3` (W/3) but found Const(Const { ty: usize, val: Param(N/#3) }) when substituting, substs=[mode::Reader, R, W, Const { ty: usize, val: Param(N/#3) }] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/69a5d2481e856a5a18885390b8cf6950b9ff8dd3/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1253:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f4f7a49dfed -
